data.enText: a small bed for a baby which can be pushed gently from side to side

data.chText: 她摇动摇篮哄婴儿入睡。
data.enText: She rocked the baby to sleep in its cradle.
the place where sth important began
Greece, the cradle of Western civilization

data.chText: （高楼外供清洁窗户等用的）吊架，托架，吊篮
data.enText: a small platform that can be moved up and down the outside of a high building, used by people cleaning windows, etc.
the part of a telephone on which the receiver rests
from the cradle to the grave
a way of referring to the whole of a person's life, from birth until death

data.chText: 老牛吃嫩草（指跟比自己年龄小很多的人发生性关系）
data.enText: to have a sexual relationship with a much younger person
to hold sb/sth gently in your arms or hands

data.chText: 老汉把幼小的婴儿轻轻抱在怀里。
data.enText: The old man cradled the tiny baby in his arms.

means: (高楼外供清洁窗户等用的)吊架，托架，吊篮

data.enText: from the cradle to the grave
a way of referring to the whole of a person's life, from birth until death

data.chText: 老牛吃嫩草（指跟比自己年龄小很多的人发生性关系）
data.enText: to have a sexual relationship with a much younger person

tr: a baby bed with sides and rockers
a trough that can be rocked back and forth
used by gold miners to shake auriferous earth in water in order to separate the gold
where something originated or was nurtured in its early existence

example: he was taught from the cradle never to cry
He cradles the child in his arms

tr: cut grain with a cradle scythe
hold or place in or as if in a cradle
example: He cradled the infant in his arms

value.def: A cradle is a baby's bed with high sides. Cradles often have curved bases so that they rock from side to side.
The cradle is the part of a telephone on which the receiver rests while it is not being used.

example.ex: I dropped the receiver back in the cradle.
example.tran: 我把听筒放回听筒架上。

value.def: A cradle is a frame which supports or protects something.

example.ex: He fixed the towing cradle round the hull.
example.tran: 他把牵引支架固定在船体上。

value.def: A place that is referred to as the cradle of something is the place where it began.

example.ex: Mali is the cradle of some of Africa's richest civilizations.
example.tran: 马里是非洲一些最悠久的文明的发祥地。
纽约，资本主义的发源地

value.def: If you cradle someone or something in your arms or hands, you hold them carefully and gently.

example.ex: I cradled her in my arms...
example.tran: 我把她轻轻地抱在怀里。

example.ex: He was sitting at the big table cradling a large bowl of milky coffee.
example.tran: 他坐在一张大桌子旁，手里捧着一大碗加了牛奶的咖啡。

value.def: If something affects you from the cradle to the grave, it affects you throughout your life.

example.ex: The bond of brotherhood was one to last from the cradle to the grave.
example.tran: 兄弟之情会延续一辈子。

trans: 从摇篮到坟墓；从坟墓到摇篮；从生到死；由摇篮到坟墓；一自摇篮至坟墓
